channel.title: paper on Neural Hydrology
channel.description: Recent content in paper on Neural Hydrology

item.title: Uncertainty Estimation with Deep Learning for Rainfall-Runoff Modelling
item.description: Deep learning based uncertainty estimation techniques and benchmarking procedure for rainfall-runoff modeling.

item.title: Rainfall-Runoff Prediction at Multiple Timescales with a Single Long Short-Term Memory Network
item.description: New LSTM-based architecture for predictions at multiple temporal time scales.

item.title: Post processing the U.S. National Water Model with a Long Short-Term Memory network
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the potential of using the LSTM as a post-processor for the US National Water Model.

item.title: A Data Scientist's Guide to Streamflow Prediction
item.description: An introduction to hydrology and especially rainfall-runoff modeling, targeted at data scientists.

item.title: A note on leveraging synergy in multiple meteorological datasets with deep learning for rainfall-runoff modeling
item.description: In this paper we show the benefits of using multiple meteorological forcing products at the same time in a single LSTM-based rainfall-runoff model over just using a single product.

item.title: What Role Does Hydrological Science Play in the Age of Machine Learning?
item.description: Opinion paper discussing the future of Hydrology, especially in the context of recent developments in Machine Learning

item.title: Toward Improved Predictions in Ungauged Basins: Exploiting the Power of Machine Learning
item.description: In this manuscript we test LSTM-based rainfall-runoff models on the task of prediction in ungauged basins and show, that a single LSTM-based model does better prediction in ungauged basins than a traditional hydrological model that was specifically calibrated for each basin individually.

item.title: The Proper Care and Feeding of CAMELS: How Limited Training Data Affects Streamflow Prediction
item.description: This paper investigates the influence of the number of training basins and the training period length on the model performance for the EA-LSTM and XGBoost

item.title: Towards learning universal, regional, and local hydrological behaviors via machine learning applied to large-sample datasets
item.description: In this manuscript we show for the first time how to train a single LSTM-based neural network as general hydrology model for hundreds of basins. Furthermore, we proposed the Entity-Aware LSTM (EA-LSTM) in which static features are used explicitly to subset the model for a specific entity (here a catchment).

item.title: Rainfallâ€“runoff modelling using Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks
item.description: First publication using LSTMs as rainfall-runoff model.
